Dating: 3RD INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not before); LATE PERIOD ?; LATE PERIOD (not after)
Technique: PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL ?; PAINTED; FAYENCE
Name: Serpent
Description: This amulet in blue-green faience comes from the excavations of W. F. Petrie at El-Lahun. It represents Neheb-kaou, a chthonic divinity, with a human body and the head of a serpent, raising a spherical object to the mouth. The serpent-god symbolises the vital force in the universe and corresponds to a form of Re-Atum.
